WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
This will be very useful for automating the compiler from an asset management / bundling code without having to write to intermediate files.

So, if the compiler can output to console, any process that calls the compiler can then redirect the standard output stream when calling the compiler and use the generated JS directly without looking up files.

something like:

tsc source.ts --outconsole
I think you can come up with a better name for the flag though!
WorkItem.Summary: A compiler flag to write code to output stream not file

Comments.Message: Thanks for the suggestion!  Assigning to Jonathan for consideration.
